parallel programming

A parallelised raytracer.

Future shines bright for raytracers, and although the theory to build one is fairly simple, they are magnificently slow.

I investigated different parallelisation ways to speed up a path tracer. I used smallpt as a base, but to keep it as simple as possible I removed the fancy pixel subdivision and tent filter—just know that they make the code faster but are not necessary.

I covered two methods:

  • OpenMP to parallelise the loop the goes through all the pixels and
  • CUDA to make the GPU do the job.
